column4: Does everyone have like 30 hal-hotplug processes on their ubuntu box, or is it just me?
you've got probably some D processes then
a d process is a deamon?
i've got one hald process running
no. It's one that is waiting on something from the kernel
if that has status D then your screwed
what app to use to find d processes, doesn't show up under system monitor
you can turn on ``Status'' in the preference
found status under system monitor, it says "sleeping" for all the hal-hotplug processes
all the hot-plug processes say they using 1.4 MB of memory each.  Are they all really using that much memory, or could these be memory shared by the processes, just reported a bunch of times?
u mean that some of the 1.4 MB is shared, and some of it is used individually by a process?

thanks, looks like I could save some memory if I take the time to figure out what the hell is wrong w those processes, on 512MB machine, might speed things up a little, i'll try to look into this week, thanks again.
but is there any good documentation on understanding more in-depth what is reported by system-monitor, would be interesting
cool, i'll google later, thanks for help
